p: The family Lauraceae includes 52 genera distributed mainly in Southeast Asia and Americas (Romoff et al. 2010). Nectandra Rol. Ex Rottb is the second genus according to the number of species in the New World (Rohwer 1993). In the Americas, these woody plants are mainly distributed in tropical and subtropical areas (Rohwer and Kubitzki 1993). Some species are used in folk medicine as antifungal, antidiarrhoeal, analgesic and antirheumatic agents (Melo et al. 2006). Studies have shown that extracts of Nectandra Rol. ex Rottb species have biological activities, such as antitumour (Le Quesne et al. 1980) and antimalaria (Bohlke et al. 1996; Muñoz et al. 2000) activity.
